definition: to drag/to tow/to trail/to hang down/to mop (the floor)/to delay/to drag on

sentences.english: The singer dwelt on a note where he shouldn't have done so.
sentences.chinese: 歌唱者不恰當地把一個音符拖長了。

sentences.english: But day doth daily draw my sorrows longer.
sentences.chinese: 但天天白天盡拖長我的苦痛。

sentences.english: We dragged the discussion out for two hours.
sentences.chinese: 我們的討論拖長了兩小時。

sentences.english: My apologies, " he drawled and picked up his teacup again."
sentences.chinese: “那我道歉，”他拖長了聲音，再次端起了茶杯。

sentences.english: Only when the ram's horn sounds a long blast may they go up to the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 到角聲拖長的時候，他們纔可到山根來。

sentences.english: His mother was speaking with a slight drawl.
sentences.chinese: 他母親說話的聲音稍稍拖長一下。

sentences.english: By the way, the "green world" long tone.
sentences.chinese: 順便把“青青世界”拖長音。

sentences.english: They prolonged the war for unknown reasons.
sentences.chinese: 不知何故，他們拖長了這場戰爭。

sentences.english: I don't want to drag out this argument any further.
sentences.chinese: 我不想再就這場爭論進一步拖長下去。

sentences.english: The old man bayed a question.
sentences.chinese: 老人以深沉拖長的聲音提出了一個問題。

sentences.english: Jim's voice trailed off with a quick shake of his head.
sentences.chinese: 吉姆的拖長了聲音與他的頭快速震動。

sentences.english: His speech was strung out for 15 minutes.
